commitResults.messageTitle: Added Add to List and List feature.
Added Mark as Done/Not Done feature.

commitResults.messageBody:
Duke is running on data that is not saved and resets every time the
Duke program is rerun.

Tasks should be saved and used for future rerun of Duke for the users.

Let's add a folder with a text file and call Scanner class to read the
text file and FileWriter class to write in the text file.

Using Scanner class to read the text file and FileWriter class to write
 in the text file helps to store task in a text file as expected.

The toString method in Deadline class prints the deadline in a String
format provided by the user.

The toString method should print in the mmm-dd-yyyy format instead of a
string.

Let's import the LocalDate class and parse in the date to the var by.
Use the var by of type LocalDate to print the date in mmm-dd-yyyy format
.

LocalDate class helps to provide a format that can be printed out for
the user.

Program is cluttered in static main with little OOP.

Program code looks untidy with no OOP in mind.

Let's add more OOP classes such as Parser to deal with making sense of
the user command, Storage to deal with loading tasks from the file and
saving tasks in the file, TaskList to contain the task list and UI to
deal with user interactions.

These classes can help to further categorize the different objects in
an OOP way which makes the code more readable.

Classes are all inside java folder with no clear packaging.

Packaging of classes offer better classification of classes which makes
file management neater and clearer.

Let's group most of the task in duke folder while grouping tasks in
task folder.

Task class and its subclasses should be in a different package from the
rest of the duke classes.

Packages and import having issues but still able to run on IDE.

Let's fix the packages and other related issues for declaration of
packages and import.

Problem with syntax. Only way to fix this.

Unable to run the application.

Cannot run the application due to file path being directed to the wrong
path.

Let's change the file path for application to the correct path.

Only way to run the application is to change the file path to the
correct path.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnit tests for classes in task package and move some classes into extra folder
commitResults.messageBody:
Classes are not in the right folder. No JUnit tests currently available.

JUnit tests are required to test the different classes. Classes are not
in right folder will affect the test.

Let's create a seedu folder for easier navigation and create JUnit tests
classes for the classes in the task package.

JUnit tests allow semi-automation of test for the respective classes.

Minimal javadoc in the some classes.

Easier to read the uses of methods and classes.

Let's add comments to the methods and classes.

Only way to make a javadoc for methods and classes.

Some parts of the code is not following the coding standard.

Following the coding standard improve the readability of the code.

Let's follow the coding standard by doing proper indentations etc.

Best way to follow the coding standard is to follow it.

No find feature for the user to find what tasks is in the TaskList.

User must be able to find their tasks if it is done or not.

Let's add some find methods in TaskList and Ui to support this issue.

TaskList helps to find the matching tasks and Ui helps to display the
tasks and messages.
